thread.title: What is the current mood among Labour supporters?
thread.title_full: What is the current mood among Labour supporters?

author: Guardian readers
title: What is the current mood among Labour supporters?
text:
Labour What is the current mood among Labour supporters? 
We want to hear from readers who support Labour on how they are feeling now and what they think the future holds for the party The party is unsure whether those leaving are supporters of Jeremy Corbyn, or his opponents Photograph: Peter Byrne/PA     12.35 GMT Last modified on   12.37 GMT 
Membership of the Labour party is expected to fall below half a million for the first time since its peak under Jeremy Corbyn. 
The peak of party membership under Corbyn was 554,000 members as of last July, which had fallen to 528,000 by December. However, senior party figures warned at the time that this lower figure might not reflect the scale of people leaving the party, as some might have simply cancelled their direct debits without informing the party formally that they wanted to leave. Share your views 
We would like to know what the mood is among Labour supporters. Have you changed your mind about the party? Perhaps you are as supportive as you were a year ago. Do you think Labour could win if there was an early election? What do you think of the news that membership is expected to fall? 
You can share your views with us by filling in our encrypted form below, anonymously if you wish. We will do our best to ensure your responses are kept secure and confidential. A selection of contributions will be featured in our reporting. Topics
